original: Metabolite quantification and analysis are essential for identifying and measuring the metabolites produced by the body. Various detection methods have been employed, with nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR) spectroscopy and mass spectrometry (MS) being the most prevalent. These techniques facilitate the universal detection, identification, and quantification of metabolites in individual patient samples. While both methods are utilized in
